title: Fabril Esporte Clube
text:
Fabril Esporte Clube, commonly known as Fabril, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Lavras">Lavras</a>, <a href="Minas%20Gerais">Minas Gerais state</a>. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> once.
History.
The club was founded on September 2, 1932. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Mineiro%20%28lower%20levels%29">Campeonato Mineiro Second Level</a> in 1984 and the <a href="Campeonato%20Mineiro%20do%20Interior">Campeonato Mineiro do Interior</a> in 1988. Fabril also competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> in <a href="1988%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1988</a>, when they were eliminated in the First Stage of the competition.
Stadium.
Fabril Esporte Clube play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Juventino%20Dias">Estádio Juventino Dias</a>, commonly known as "Estádio Municipal". The stadium has a maximum capacity of 5,000 people. They also play at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20UFLA">Estádio UFLA</a>, which is a property of the <a href="Federal%20University%20of%20Lavras">Federal University of Lavras</a>, and it has a maximum capacity of 13,000 people.
